11.name: Manfred Steyer
11.title: Trainer and Consultant
11.shortBio: Trainer and Consultant with focus on Angular. Google Developer Expert (GDE) and Microsoft MVP. Writes for O'Reilly, Hanser, the German Java Magazine, windows.developer and Heise. Regularly speaks at conferences.
11.bio: Trainer and Consultant with focus on Angular. Google Developer Expert (GDE) and Microsoft MVP. Writes for O'Reilly, Hanser, the German Java Magazine, windows.developer and Heise. Regularly speaks at conferences.

12.name: Raul Jimenez
12.title: Software Engineer
12.shortBio: Raul is a software engineer passionate about JS frameworks, web technologies and cross-platform development. Since 2012 he's focused in Angular, HTML5 video and his open source project Videogular.
12.bio: Raul is a software engineer passionate about JS frameworks, web technologies and cross-platform development. Since 2012 he's focused in Angular, HTML5 video and his open source project Videogular. He manages his own company in Barcelona working as a consultant architect for companies around the world helping them to build high-performance web apps. In his spare time he's usually involved in the community as an Angular Google Developer Expert helping local meetups, writing blog posts, speaking at conferences and contributing to open source projects. He lives in Barcelona and is happy by default :)

13.name: Uri Shaked
13.title: Software Engineer
13.shortBio: Uri Shaked is a Google Developer Expert for Web Technologies. He created the popular angular-moment open source module and regularly speaks about Web and IoT-related technologies in conferences and meetups. Among his interests are reverse engineering, hardware hacking, building 3D-printed robots and games, playing music and Salsa dancing.
13.bio: Uri Shaked is a Google Developer Expert for Web Technologies. He created the popular angular-moment open source module and regularly speaks about Web and IoT-related technologies in conferences and meetups. Among his interests are reverse engineering, hardware hacking, building 3D-printed robots and games, playing music and Salsa dancing.

14.name: Sebastian Witalec
14.title: Technical Evangelist
14.shortBio: Sebastian Witalec is a Technical Evangelist for Progress/Telerik with over 8 years of experience in software engineering and architecture.
14.bio: Sebastian Witalec is a Technical Evangelist for Progress/Telerik with over 8 years of experience in software engineering and architecture. Sebastian has passion for all types of technologies. However in the last few years his focus shifted towards cross platform Mobile development where he gained experience with Apache Cordova and NativeScript.

15.name: Tracy Lee
15.title: Entrepreneur
15.shortBio: Tracy is a speaker, writer, and serial entrepreneur passionate about JavaScript and new technologies. After the acquisition of her last startup, she learned how to code and spends her time as a junior developer these days. Tracy spends her time building the JS community through her new startup, This Dot and runs the Modern Web podcast and events.
15.bio: Tracy is a speaker, writer, and serial entrepreneur passionate about JavaScript and new technologies. After the acquisition of her last startup, she learned how to code and spends her time as a junior developer these days. Tracy spends her time building the JS community through her new startup, This Dot and runs the Modern Web podcast and events. She loves open source projects, pairing with friends, and empowering people to do awesome things. Tracy is also an organizer of ng-cruise and track chair for QCon.

16.name: Wassim Chegham
16.title: Developer Advocate
16.shortBio: Wassim (aka manekinekko on Twitter/Github) is a Developer Advocate based in Paris. He is also a Developer Expert in Web technologies nominated by Google. He enjoys writing technical articles, meeting developers at events, speaking at conferences and contributing to open source projects: contributor to Angular core, Documentation, Universal and more… Wassim’s mantra: Love what you do and do what you love.
16.bio: Wassim (aka manekinekko on Twitter/Github) is a Developer Advocate based in Paris. He is also a Developer Expert in Web technologies nominated by Google. He enjoys writing technical articles, meeting developers at events, speaking at conferences and contributing to open source projects: contributor to Angular core, Documentation, Universal and more… Wassim’s mantra: Love what you do and do what you love.

82.name: Brecht Billiet
82.title: Trainer
82.shortBio: Brecht is a trainer, blogger and software engineer passionate about architecture and best-practices. Brecht uses the technologies that he teaches in his workshops on a daily basis in different projects. One of his main activities is kickstarting new Angular projects in companies and guiding them in the right direction.
82.bio: Brecht is a trainer, blogger and software engineer passionate about architecture and best-practices. Brecht uses the technologies that he teaches in his workshops on a daily basis in different projects. One of his main activities is kickstarting new Angular projects in companies and guiding them in the right direction.

83.name: Kwinten Pisman
83.title: Mentor
83.shortBio: Kwinten is a highly motivated developer with a passion for the fast changing front end world. He mainly focusses on Angular 2 and RxJS nowadays and transfers his knowledge to other developers through intensive coaching and workshops.
83.bio: Kwinten is a highly motivated developer with a passion for the fast changing front end world. He mainly focusses on Angular 2 and RxJS nowadays and transfers his knowledge to other developers through intensive coaching and workshops.
